data.prayer: Lord, like in the church of Antioch, where you gathered many prophets and teachers, please gather many prophets and teachers in the state of Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan.
data.verse: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, please bless the leaders of the the state of Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan who work hard at shepherding and guiding your people.
data.verse: With upright heart he shepherded them and guided them with his skillful hand.

data.prayer: Oh Lord, show the fatherless in the state of Kalbajar-Lachin that you can be their real Father.
data.verse: I will be to you a Father. you will be to me sons and daughters,’ says the Lord Almighty.

data.prayer: Father, we rejoice that you who began a good work in the church of Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan will carry it on to completion until the day of Jesus Christ!
data.verse: being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, 0.2% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Father, let knowledge and depth of insight abound more and more in the church of Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan.
data.verse: And this is my prayer: that your love may abound more and more in knowledge and depth of insight,

data.prayer: Jesus, protect the vulnerable in Kalbajar-Lachin, Azerbaijan from the evil one.
data.verse: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the church in the state of Kalbajar-Lachin to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...
